thread.title: High school coach resigns, denies texting students
thread.title_full: High school coach resigns, denies texting students

title: High school coach resigns, denies texting students
text:
Holmes County Central High School football coach resigns, denies texting students 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/23/15 4:52 am EDT - Updated: 10/23/15 4:52 am EDT 
LEXINGTON, Mississippi â€” Holmes County Central High School's athletic director and football coach has resigned after school officials say he violated the district's texting policy with students. 
Multiple media outlets report that Tony Woolfolk resigned from the Lexington school on Tuesday. A woman says that Woolfolk sent her 15-year-old daughter hundreds of text messages. 
The woman said she filed a complaint with the Holmes County Sheriff's Department on Monday. Sheriff Willie March told The Clarion Ledger ( http://on.thec-l.com/1NXjCjn ) on Wednesday that he had not received a complaint. 
Administrators say district policy prohibits faculty and staff from text messaging students. The subject matter of the text messages has not been disclosed. 
Woolfolk denies improper communication. He told the newspaper that he resigned to care for his ailing father.
